title.narrative: Puljen til mindre projekter og udviklingsaktiviteter (Minipuljen)

description.narrative:
CISU is an association of 280 + popular organizations in Denmark which has two main activities: 1) a capacity building and advisory system and 2) the administration of the Civil Society Fund. CISU and its member organization work together to contribute to the following objectives: 1) qualified popular participation in development cooperation, 2) a strong development policy role for civil society in Denmark, and 3) support to long-term cooperation with civil society in the South in order to strengthen the building of democratic, independent and diversified civil society in the South. Danida funding is utilized for objective one and three.
The Civil Society Fund supports the cooperation between Danish popular and local partners in developing countries. The aim is to provide a funding option that is flexible and adapted to the working methods of popular organizations predominantly are based on voluntary work, without compromising the quality of interventions. There were two calls for proposalsin 2013. 145 applications were received and 85 were approved (58.6 pct.).
One of the objectives of the Civil Society Fund is to provide opportunities for the less experienced organizations. Of the total 832 applications since 2002, 274 (32.9 pct.) are from less experienced organizations. Looking isolated at the applications approved in the two 2013 calls (Dec. call is pending), there have been a total of 145 applications, of which 49 are from the less experienced. Of the 85 approved applications, 13 were from less experienced, (15.3 pct.).
CISU has in 2013 developed two new types of support: 1) a program modality under the Civil Society Fund (2 programs approved in 2013).
CISU held 476 advisory sessions and 80 courses in 2013.
